page.title: 19Local History Medieval Times
page.content: In 1147, David I founded St.Mary's Abbey at Cambuskenneth, Stirling. A document said that the Chapel of Dunipace had to pay money to the Abbey. The famous Crusaders, the {Knights Templar,}did not have a house in Denny but they owned land which is still known as Temple Denny. They are said to have had a sanctuary where people in trouble with the law could be safe. "Go to Denny" is an expression still in use and is thought to refer to this sanctuary. In the 13th century,{William Wallace}was educated by his uncle, a priest, at Dunipace. Later he attacked Airth Castle to free that uncle who was a prisoner there. Wallace and{Bruce}had a meeting at Dunipace. After Bruce died his body was taken to Dunfermline for burial. The procession stayed a night at Dunipace.
